title: Performance Analysis Engineer
summary: As part of our Silicon Technologies group, you’ll help design and manufacture our next-generation, high-performance, power-efficient processor, system-on-chip (SoC). You’ll ensure Apple products and services can seamlessly handle the tasks that make them beloved by millions. Joining this group means you’ll be crafting and building the technology that fuels Apple’s devices. Together, we enable our customers to do all the things they love with their devices.
description:
YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
-  Analyse GPU performance from micro benches to real life content (games, pro-apps etc.).
-  Interact with architecture, software and hardware engineers to identify bottlenecks and propose solutions
-  Develop studies to validate GPU performance.
key_qualifications:
Architecture knowledge of at least one of the main SoC components (GPU, CPU, Interconnect & Memory hierarchy).
Strong hardware and software debug skills.
Strong data analysis skills: able to relate performance data to HW architecture and behaviour.
Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or Perl.
Ability to work well in a multi-site team, capable of planning your own tasks, estimate deadlines and meet schedules.
Excellent communications skills, and be self-motivated and well organised
Knowledge on hardware design.
additional_requirements:
DESIRABLE SKILLS
-  Previous experience in performance analysis of complex systems and understanding trade-offs
-  Experience in GPU architecture
-  Experience on system verilog and simulation/emulation tools
